| A soldier mummy:* can [survive underwater](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious").
* [does not breathe](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless").
* is [mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless").
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat.
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead").
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* resists death magic.
* does not naturally [regenerate](/wiki/Regenerate "Regenerate") HP. |                                                                                          |

A **soldier mummy**, M, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"). The soldier mummy is a fairly strong type of [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)") [mummy](/wiki/Mummy "Mummy") that has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

A soldier mummy has a weapon attack and an [offhand](/wiki/Twoweapon#dNetHack "Twoweapon") weapon attack, and has a [passive attack](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack") on death that inflicts [mummy curses](/wiki/Mummy_curse "Mummy curse"): a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") subjected to their dying curse can lose 1-7 points of [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck"), [have their items cursed](/wiki/Curse_items "Curse items"), or have their current HP halved and end up [screaming](/index.php?title=Screaming\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Screaming (page does not exist)") for 2 (more) turns. Like other mummies, soldier mummies possess [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance"), and [death resistance](/wiki/Death_resistance "Death resistance").

A soldier mummy is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to consume, which primarily comes up when it is [digested](/wiki/Digest "Digest") by another monster.

## Generation

Randomly-generated soldier mummies are always generated hostile.

A soldier mummy is generated with a [waistcloth](/index.php?title=Waistcloth\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Waistcloth (page does not exist)"), a [wooden](/wiki/Wood "Wood") [tower shield](/wiki/Tower_shield "Tower shield"), and a weapon that has a 9⁄10 chance of being a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") and will otherwise be a [khopesh](/index.php?title=Khopesh\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Khopesh (page does not exist)").

A soldier mummy [does not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

## Encyclopedia entry

But for an account of the manner in which the body was  
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials  
employed in the process, and the words of power which were  
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have  
recourse to a very interesting papyrus which has been edited  
and translated by M. Maspero under the title of Le Rituel de  
l'Embaumement. ...  
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now  
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of  
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,  
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple  
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready  
for the tomb.

\[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Soldier_mummy\&action=edit)*

html:
Soldier mummy

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
M soldier mummy (No tile)
Difficulty 13
Attacks Weapon 4d4 physical, Offhand Weapon 4d4 physical, Passive 0d0 inflict curses
M soldier mummy (No tile)
Difficulty 13
Attacks

Weapon 4d4 physical, Offhand Weapon 4d4 physical, Passive 0d0 inflict curses

Base level 11
Base experience 290
Speed 12
Base AC 4
Base MR 30
Alignment -5 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 200
Size medium
Resistances cold, sleep, poison

A soldier mummy:

  • can survive underwater.
  • does not breathe.
  • is mindless.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is undead.
  • is a human.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • has infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • resists death magic.
  • does not naturally regenerate HP.

A soldier mummy, M, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack. The soldier mummy is a fairly strong type of human mummy that has infravision.

A soldier mummy has a weapon attack and an offhand weapon attack, and has a passive attack on death that inflicts mummy curses: a hero subjected to their dying curse can lose 1-7 points of luck, have their items cursed, or have their current HP halved and end up screaming for 2 (more) turns. Like other mummies, soldier mummies possess cold resistance, sleep resistance, poison resistance, drain resistance, and death resistance.

A soldier mummy is poisonous to consume, which primarily comes up when it is digested by another monster.

Generation

Randomly-generated soldier mummies are always generated hostile.

A soldier mummy is generated with a waistcloth, a wooden tower shield, and a weapon that has a 9⁄10 chance of being a spear and will otherwise be a khopesh.

A soldier mummy does not leave a corpse upon death.

Encyclopedia entry

But for an account of the manner in which the body was
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials
employed in the process, and the words of power which were
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have
recourse to a very interesting papyrus which has been edited
and translated by M. Maspero under the title of Le Rituel de
l'Embaumement. ...
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready
for the tomb.

[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]
This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''soldier mummy''', {{brightgreen|M}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]]. The soldier mummy is a fairly strong type of [[Human (monster attribute)|human]] [[mummy]] that has [[infravision]].

A soldier mummy has a weapon attack and an [[Twoweapon#dNetHack|offhand]] weapon attack, and has a [[passive attack]] on death that inflicts [[mummy curse]]s: a [[hero]] subjected to their dying curse can lose 1-7 points of [[luck]], [[Curse items|have their items cursed]], or have their current HP halved and end up [[screaming]] for 2 (more) turns. Like other mummies, soldier mummies possess [[cold resistance]], [[sleep resistance]], [[poison resistance]], [[drain resistance]], and [[death resistance]].

A soldier mummy is [[poisonous]] to consume, which primarily comes up when it is [[digest]]ed by another monster.

==Generation==
Randomly-generated soldier mummies are always generated hostile.

A soldier mummy is generated with a [[waistcloth]], a [[wood]]en [[tower shield]], and a weapon that has a {{frac|9|10}} chance of being a [[spear]] and will otherwise be a [[khopesh]].

A soldier mummy [[Corpseless|does not leave a corpse]] upon death.

Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now

|[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]
